entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 9:46AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Frost Possible Tonight... Frost is possible tonight across the Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. Clear skies this evening will allow temperatures to fall rapidly after sunset, with temperature dropping into the 30s after midnight. Frost will be most likely in low lying areas. Clouds moving north over the area on Thursday morning will cause

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN COFFEE AND WESTERN GENEVA COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Opp, moving southeast at 20 mph. At 410 PM CDT, the Andalusia-Opp Municipal Airport gusted to 41 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 13 at 3:28PM MST until September 13 at 6:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR COCONINO COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 330 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning east of Doney Park has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However, heavy rain is still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 12:57PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS GILA COUNTY... At 1256 PM MST, radar indicated strong thunderstorms were located near San Carlos, or 12 miles east of Globe, moving east at 40 mph. Conditions are becoming more favorable for the development of additional thunderstorms. Some storms may become strong to severe. Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail will be possible.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Globe, Miami; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 13 at 3:27PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect until 6AM on Friday . At 417 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm over Reptile Gardens, or 5 miles southwest of Rapid City, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 13 at 5:28PM CDT until September 13 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Jefferson County in southeastern Texas... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 528 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 13 miles south of La Belle, or 15 miles west of Sabine Pass, moving south at 15 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:27PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MASON COUNTY THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 526 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Loyal Valley, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Chambers County through 600 PM CDT... At 522 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stowell, or 11 miles southwest of Hamshire, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 4:32PM CDT until September 13 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Mason, McCulloch and Menard. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT.

entry.title: Fire Warning issued September 13 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: The following message is transmitted at the request of Aransas Pass Emergency Management Agency and Aransas Pass Fire Chief. Evacuation notices have been issued for parts of the city of Aransas Pass, including both sides of Ireland Street between 9th Street and 13th Street, the Gettaway RV Park, Gaslight Village, and Aransas Bay RV Park. A temporary shelter has been established

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:14AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of expected air and dewpoint temperatures will result in maximum Heat Index values between 105 and 109 degrees inclusive today. In addition, Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 4:03PM MDT until September 13 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Utah, including the following county, Uintah. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 3:42PM MDT until September 13 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 342 PM MDT, Capitol Reef National Park rangers have reported flash flooding in Grand Wash and Sulphur Creek. SR-24 between Hickman Bridge and Grand Wash is impassable due to a debris flow.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 13 at 4:06PM EDT until September 14 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High risk for rip currents expected. * WHERE...In Maryland, Maryland Beaches County. In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Virginia Beach, and Accomack and Northampton Counties.

entry.title: Frost Advisory issued September 13 at 2:22PM CDT until September 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 33 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Lincoln, Oneida, Vilas, and Forest Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Frost could harm sensitive outdoor vegetation. Sensitive outdoor plants may be killed if left uncovered.
